1.0.1.name: wordpress/map-images
1.0.1.description: This plugin parses a post looking for all image files with GPS exif data. It then appends a Google Map to each post with a marker for each image found in that post. It can include both locally stored images and remotely stored images. In order for Google Maps to work properly, a Google Maps API Key must be obtained. The key is free for a limited number of map generations, 25,000 requests/day at the time of this writing (March 19, 2013). For more information on obtaining an API Key, visit Google's developer resources (https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial).
